content: Given comments in the syntax thread it seems that we are about ready to start implementation of an initial PoC in the compiler. Is anyone interested in taking that on.

To tackle ongoing design questions and to draft an RFC (which I think will be easier to do slowly, at the same time as implementation, rather than leaving it all for later), I think it would be useful to have a repo for the project group. Is there one already? If not, any objections to creating one?

Nick Cameron said:

Given comments in the syntax thread it seems that we are about ready to start implementation of an initial PoC in the compiler. Is anyone interested in taking that on.

I'm willing to work on it, but I likely won't be able to do it entirely on my own.

@Connor Horman @Mario Carneiro Could we create a repo to start drafting an RFC and collect design notes? (I'm proposing doing this in parallel with implementation with the goal of having an RFC in the distant future, but I think it would be good to have somewhere that is easy to collaborate and more permanent than Zulip to collect notes during implementation)
@Connor Horman is there a tracking issue in the Rust repo for deref patterns?
There is not a tracking issue yet AFAIK. Though getting a repo to draft an RFC would be good. I don't know what the procedure for that would be, though.
There is an issue on the lang-team repo for the project, though I believe that's more for the procedural side of discussion (like an MCP issue) than the technical side like a tracking issue would be.
@Josh Triplett could you clone us a project group repo please?
/me needs to step away for a bit. May be able to do so if someone doesn't do so first.
cc #t-lang
(sorry, have been in meetings all day)
No worries :-)

@Nick Cameron I cloned the template and created a repo for you https://github.com/rust-lang/project-deref-patterns/ - for now just granted you admin access since I know your github nick. We should get a rust-lang/team file created with the members and a [[github]] section so we can move ACL over to a github team instead of individuals.
Great, thanks @simulacrum !
Could I get access as well? chorman0773 on github (I should also be on the original MCP and Charter PR)
@Connor Horman you should have an invite for the repo. Do you want to submit a team project group PR to https://github.com/rust-lang/team/tree/master/teams so it can be managed properly?
I'll update the repo to fill in the blanks and ask you to review the PR

Connor Horman you should have an invite for the repo. Do you want to submit a team project group PR to https://github.com/rust-lang/team/tree/master/teams so it can be managed properly?

I can probably do that tomorrow.
Tracking issue: https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/issues/87121
Open issues: https://github.com/rust-lang/project-deref-patterns/issues

@Connor Horman re implementation, do you need anything more from the design before you start? Are you happy to just dive in or would you like some pointers from a compiler expert (I'm not one, but I can find one :-) )? Are there any places you'd like help, or would you like to divide the work ahead of time at all? (I'm happy to help out as needed).

I can do the stdlib stuff (I'll go with an internal DerefPure trait with the deref_pattern_internals feature for now, since the trait isn't part of the main feature, just an implementation-detail). For the actual compiler stuff, I'd probably need some help from an expert on rustc, yes.

I asked a couple of people who seem to have contributed a lot to match in the compiler if they could help - https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/issues/87121#issuecomment-881113069 - I wasn't sure of their Zulip nicks
@Connor Horman did you have a chance to get started? Are there any tasks you'd like to split off for me or somebody else to work on?
Not yet. I can soon, though.
